nodes.bodyText:
I wrongly assumed (looking at the results) that the initialization was done only once for each worker, since the query is named (s):
$db->prepare('s', 'SELECT id, randomnumber FROM World WHERE id = $1');
This is indeed not the case.
So you only use $db->s to avoid preparing the same query several times, it's ok.
I have some difficulties to figure out the implementation logic of Swoole_postgres (which doesn't respect the same interface as Mysq).
You can just make it a little shorter by using:
$db->s ??= $db->prepare('s', 'SELECT id, randomnumber FROM World WHERE id = $1');

Hi @jcheron, these variable are for checking if the prepare query is executed at least once and making sure they are executed only once. For performance reason, these prepare queries are only executed one time for all the requests after the change. Hope this make sense?

Hi @doubaokun
I modified my previous comment after testing
